description: The Indian Army swiftly responded to a distress call on September 4th, launching a rescue operation to evacuate two South Korean nationals stranded at the Kongmarula Pass in Ladakh. Helicopters were deployed within 15 minutes of receiving the request, successfully airlifting the individuals from the high-altitude location around 9:15 pm.

title: 'Locked himself in bathroom': This actor recalls school bullying; shares story
description: Hrithik Roshan, celebrated for his acting, dance, and looks, overcame a difficult childhood marked by stuttering and a spinal problem that doctors said would prevent him from becoming an actor. He faced immense challenges, including locking himself in a bathroom to practice speaking without stammering.

title: 6 murders and counting – the heavy price of being a temporary teacher in Chhattisgarh
Messi not playing WC 2026? He says: 'It's only logical to think I might not'
description: Lionel Messi is uncertain about participating in the 2026 World Cup to defend Argentina's title, citing his age and physical condition as key factors. After scoring twice in a 3-0 victory against Venezuela, the 38-year-old stated he will assess his fitness and performance throughout the upcoming season before making a final decision.

title: Google, Microsoft CEOs promise to make AI more accessible to students
description: U.S. First Lady Melania Trump took part in a meeting of the White House Task Force on AI Education along with its members from Big Tech companies

title: Anutin Charnvirakul wins vote in Parliament, set to become Thailand’s next Prime Minister
description: Anutin Charnvirakul secures a majority of the 492 MPs sitting in the National Assembly’s lower house.

title: Rs 60 crore 'cheating case': Lookout circular for Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra
description: Mumbai police have issued a Lookout Circular against Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra concerning a Rs 60 crore cheating case. The Economic Offences Wing took this action due to the couple's frequent international travel. The case, registered at Juhu police station, alleges they defrauded a businessman in a loan-cum-investment deal.

'Bidi-Bihar' row: Deleted Cong post on GST sparks backlash; BJP hits back
description: A social media post by the Kerala Congress linking GST reforms to Bihar has ignited a political firestorm. The now-deleted post, referencing reduced taxes on bidis, was slammed by BJP and JD(U) leaders as an insult to the state and its people. The controversy has intensified ahead of Bihar's assembly elections, with the BJP-JD(U) alliance using it to attack Congress.

GST 2.0: Full comprehensive list of items with revised rates
description: New GST rates 2025 full list: The Finance Minister announced significant GST rate cuts and slab changes, effective September 22, 2025, leading to cheaper daily-use items. Many food items will attract 0% GST, and life and health insurance will also see zero tax. The government is monitoring price changes, while luxury and sin goods may face higher taxes, potentially reaching a 40% bracket.

Maharashtra minister becomes 1st Tesla owner: Pratak Sarnaik takes 'Y' model home
description: Maharashtra Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik received the first Tesla Model Y in Mumbai, aiming to promote electric vehicle adoption. He intends to gift the car to his grandson, fostering early awareness of green mobility. Maharashtra is committed to EV transition with incentives and MSRTC's procurement of 5,000 e-buses, aligning with the Prime Minister's clean mobility vision.

‘Illegitimate targeting’: US puts sanctions on Palestinian rights groups
description: The U.S. sanctioned three Palestinian human rights organizations for allegedly instigating the International Criminal Court's (ICC) investigation into Israel, according to the Treasury Department. Secretary Rubio stated the groups targeted Israeli nationals without consent, prompting the action. The ICC's later arrest warrants for Israeli and Hamas leaders over war crimes allegations further fueled the controversy.

title: China’s Victory Day parade reveals the PLA’s transformation
Huawei unveils second generation of Mate XTs, their trifold smartphones
Clash over 'samosas': UP man thrashed with kicks and punches by wife, in-laws
description: In Pilibhit, a domestic dispute over samosas turned violent when Shivam Kumar failed to bring them home as requested by his wife, Sangeeta. The argument escalated the next day, leading to Sangeeta, along with her parents and uncle, allegedly assaulting Shivam. Police have registered an FIR, and an investigation is underway to determine the full scope of the incident.

title: Who is Mitesh Khapra? The IIT Madras professor featured in TIME Magazine
description: Mitesh Khapra, IIT Madras professor, features in TIME's 2025 AI 100 list. He is recognised for NLP and machine learning contributions. Khapra focuses on AI systems for India's diverse languages. His work addresses challenges in English-centric AI models. He aims to make AI accessible across India. AI4Bharat, his project, builds datasets for Indian languages. This initiative supports government's Bhashini mission.

Is it a bank holiday on September 5? Check details
description: Banks across multiple Indian states remained closed on September 5 due to Id-E-Milad and Thiruvonam, as per the RBI holiday calendar. While digital banking services continued uninterrupted, physical branch visits were necessary for certain transactions. Maharashtra, however, shifted the Eid-e-Milad holiday in Mumbai to September 8, 2025, impacting government securities and related markets.

title: ‘Will restore Amma’s rule’: Sasikala rakes up AIADMK unity debate; signals political comeback
description: VK Sasikala has reignited the AIADMK leadership debate, asserting the party's need for unity to challenge the DMK in the 2026 elections. Senior leader K A Sengottaiyan supports Sasikala, urging EPS to reconcile with former members.

Joe Biden undergoes skin cancer surgery, fresh videos show head wound - watch
description: Ex-US President, Joe Biden, was recently spotted with a visible mark on his head. Reports confirm that the 82-year-old underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer treatment. Biden was seen leaving a church in Rehoboth Beach with a bandage. Earlier, he was seen wearing a cap to conceal the wound. In May, aides disclosed Biden's diagnosis of Stage 4 prostate cancer. Biden shared a message about strength in difficult times.

title: Mumbai wakes up to light rain amid a yellow alert; showers to let up from Sunday
'34 vehicles ready with human bombs': Lashkar-e-Jihadi sends warning; Mumbai on high alert
description: Mumbai Police are on high alert. A threat message warned of multiple terror attacks. The message claimed 34 vehicles are fitted with human bombs. Lashkar-e-Jihadi claimed responsibility. They said 14 Pakistani terrorists entered India. The threat mentioned 400 kg of RDX explosives. Mumbai Police are investigating the threat. Security has been tightened across the city.

description: Divya Deshmukh, after her Women's World Cup victory, revealed her mentors, Csaba Balogh and Abhimanyu Puranik. At the Grand Swiss 2025, Puranik, who had just enjoyed a Disneyland vacation, defeated his protégé, Divya. Puranik, a Mumbai-born Punekar, started chess at five and praised Divya's amazing mentality and potential for future dominance in Indian chess.

'Department of war': Why Trump wants to rename Pentagon; executive order likely today
description: President Trump is set to sign an executive order allowing the Pentagon to be referred to as the "Department of War," a secondary designation endorsed by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth. Trump hinted at the change, recalling the department's historical name during World Wars. This move follows Hegseth's actions to reverse earlier policies, including reattributing Confederate-era fort names.

Dramatic arrest in Kannauj: SP leader Kaish Khan found hiding in mattress
description: Kaish Khan, a Samajwadi Party leader and former treasurer, was apprehended in Kannauj for violating a banishment order. Authorities had instructed Khan to remain outside the district limits on July 28. Acting on a tip, Kotwali police discovered him concealed in the loft of his residence.

Massive blast at Nagpur RDX plant: Shockwaves damaged buildings 2km away
description: A powerful explosion at Solar Defence and Aerospace Limited's RDX facility near Nagpur claimed one life and injured over 25. The blast, which occurred post-midnight, demolished the unit and sent shockwaves kilometers away. This marks the second fatal incident at the defence manufacturer in two years, raising concerns about safety lapses.

NIRF 2025: IIM Ahmedabad ranks first again in management, check top 10 here
description: IIM Ahmedabad has secured the top spot in the NIRF 2025 management institute rankings for the sixth consecutive year. IIM Bangalore and IIM Kozhikode follow closely behind. While IIMs dominate, non-IIMs like IIT Delhi's DMS, MDI Gurgaon, and XLRI Jamshedpur also feature in the top 10, showcasing a diverse range of quality management education options in India.

From plush to slush: Yamuna floodwaters swamp Noida’s luxury farmhouses
description: Rising Yamuna floodwaters have submerged luxury farmhouses along the Noida floodplain, reviving memories of last year's devastating inundation. Caretakers are evacuating properties as the river approaches record levels, impacting over 1,000 farmhouses with lavish amenities.

World No. 5 GM Muzychuk forgets about clock, suffers massive setback at Grand Swiss
description: The FIDE Grand Swiss witnessed a stunning upset as Hungarian teenager Zsóka Gaál defeated world No. 5 Anna Muzychuk. Reigning world champion D Gukesh of India began strongly, defeating Etienne Bacrot, while Praggnanandhaa drew with Jeffery Xiong. In other matches, Vaishali secured a win, adding to the excitement of the tournament's opening day.

title: Series of earthquakes hit Afghanistan days after quake killed over 2,000
description: A series of earthquakes, including a 5.2 magnitude tremor, have struck Afghanistan's Hindukush region, causing widespread devastation. The quakes have resulted in over 2,200 fatalities and 3,000 injuries, exacerbating an already dire humanitarian situation worsened by recent flash floods. International aid is being mobilized, with the WFP dispatching emergency supplies and India airlifting relief materials to assist affected communities.

title: News Today Live Updates, 5 September | PM Modi inaugurates Jawaharlal Nehru Port Authority’s new container cargo terminal
Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai and more: Trump hosts White House dinner; Musk absent
description: US president Trump hosted tech leaders, including Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerberg, at the White House to discuss AI and US investments. The meeting highlighted the growing influence of Indian-American executives in Silicon Valley. Trump downplayed jobs data, mentioned speaking with Putin, and Google's CEO expressed relief over the antitrust case's end.

title: Teachers Day 2025: Bollywood’s ‘OG’ professor Aamir Khan could have replaced my moral science teacher and no one would’ve noticed
Bollywood’s greatest singer was inspired by a fakir in Lahore, was abandoned by first wife during Partition: ‘She didn’t want to come to India’
Shilpa Shetty Kundra has two breakfasts on these days, and ‘butter’ is an essential part of it: ‘I like to keep it natural’
Pathanmajra still absconding: Switches off cellphones, may have fled to UP, say cops
Afghanistan hit by fourth earthquake since August 31, latest of magnitude 5.4
NIRF rankings 2025: Hindu, Miranda House remain best two colleges of India
description: Delhi University (DU) continues its dominance in the NIRF 2025 rankings, securing top positions with 32 colleges on the list. Hindu College and Miranda House retain their top spots, while DU achieves its best-ever fifth position among universities. Other Delhi institutions like JNU and Jamia Millia Islamia also shine, with AIIMS Delhi leading in medical and dental categories.

title: 'Phone call' halts mining crackdown: Trouble for Ajit Pawar over ‘threat’ to cop?
description: Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar faces accusations of obstructing IPS officer Anjana Krishna's efforts to curb illegal sand mining in Solapur. A video circulating online purportedly captures Pawar instructing Krishna to halt action against an NCP member involved. Opposition leaders are demanding an apology, alleging Pawar threatened the officer after she insisted on verifying his identity.

title: 5th death in 10 months: BITS Pilani Goa student found dead on campus
description: Rishi Nair, a 19-year-old BITS Pilani Goa student from Bengaluru, was found dead in his hostel room, marking the fifth student death in ten months. Police report Rishi was battling depression following his girlfriend's suicide. His parents had moved him to the Goa campus for support.

title: Giorgio Armani dies at 91: Built a $10 billion fashion empire
description: Giorgio Armani, the iconic Italian fashion designer renowned for his elegant and sophisticated designs, has passed away at the age of 91. Credited with redefining modern Italian style through minimalist designs and timeless sophistication, Armani's creations graced red carpets and boardrooms alike. He built his independent fashion house into a global powerhouse, leaving an indelible mark on the fashion world.

title: GST rate cut: TVs, ACs, laptops see relief; what happens to mobile phones
description: The GST Council has approved a revised two-tier rate structure, reducing the slabs to 5% and 18%, effective September 22. Consumer electronics like TVs, air conditioners, and dishwashers will see a price cut as they move from the 28% to the 18% GST slab. However, mobile phones and laptops will continue to be taxed at 18%.
